criteria_description: Provision of Performance Security as stipulated in Clause 10.1, including its period of validity (Clause 10.2) and claims handling (Clause 10.3).
Evidence and terms of insurance to be provided (Clause 25.1) with adequacy of insurance verified (Clause 25.2) and compliance with policy conditions (Clause 25.4).
Third‑party insurance covering employer’s property and other liabilities (Clause 23.1).
Decennial liability coverage for structural works (Clause 8.3).
Compliance with all applicable statutes, regulations and BCA licensing requirements (Clause 26.1).
Contractor must maintain qualified staff, including a designated Safety Officer (Clause 35.4) and ensure language ability of the contractor’s representative (Clause 15.2).
Engagement of staff and labour in accordance with labour laws and regulations (Clause 34.1).
Quality of materials, plant and workmanship must meet specified standards (Clause 36.1).
Contractor’s equipment, temporary works and materials must be for exclusive use on the works and approved as per Clause 54.1‑54.7.
Contractor must provide a detailed programme and cash‑flow estimates (Clauses 14.1‑14.4).
Regular site inspections, testing and reporting as required (Clauses 37.1‑37.5, 38.1‑38.2, 39.1‑39.2).
Contractor to keep the site clear and maintain site safety, security and environmental protection (Clauses 32.1, 19.1‑19.2).
Submission of records of safety and health, accident reports and maintenance of a safety officer (Clauses 35.2‑35.4).
Contractor’s employees must be suitably qualified and supervised (Clause 16.1).
Contractor must comply with BCA’s inspection and approval processes for variations and dayworks (Clauses 51.1‑52.4).
Submission of the Completed BCA Tender Form (BCA/Tender Form – Fixed Price) indicating registration with the Building and Construction Authority.
Statutory Declarations confirming Tax Clearance and compliance with the Workplace Safety and Health Act (WSHA).
Compliance with all applicable BCA standards and Singapore Standards (e.g., BCA Code of Practice for Structural Works, SS 550, LTA Guidelines).
Provision of a performance bond equal to 5% of the contract value, to be submitted within 14 days of contract award.
Contractor’s All Risks (CAR) insurance covering the full contract value.
Public Liability Insurance with a minimum coverage of SGD 10,000,000 per occurrence.
Submission of a detailed Financial Proposal including a breakdown of the fixed price and unit rates for re‑measurable items.
Company profile must demonstrate a minimum of three (3) similar structural strengthening and concrete repair projects.
Relevant Project Experience will be evaluated (15% weighting) as part of the technical evaluation.
Technical Proposal must detail the project methodology, programme schedule, and quality control plan.
Compliance with the Scope of Works (20% weighting) as part of the technical evaluation.
Methodology and Programme submission (15% weighting) as part of the technical evaluation.
Quality Assurance & Safety Plan (10% weighting) as part of the technical evaluation.
Capability to execute concrete repair, steel reinforcement installation, post‑tensioning, and associated temporary works (shoring, propping).
Ability to manage site works including traffic and pedestrian management, waste disposal, and site housekeeping in accordance with LTA guidelines and BCA environmental requirements.
Statutory Declarations must be submitted, including Tax Clearance and WSHA (Workplace Safety and Health Act) compliance, confirming the contractor’s registration and legal standing.
Completion of the mandatory BCA/Tender Form – Fixed Price, indicating registration with the Building and Construction Authority (BCA).
A performance bond equal to 5% of the contract value (SGD 450,000) must be submitted within 14 days of contract award.
Contractor’s All Risks (CAR) insurance covering the full contract value is required.
Public Liability Insurance with a minimum coverage of SGD 10,000,000 per occurrence must be provided.
A detailed Financial Proposal (breakdown of fixed price and unit rates for re‑measurable items) must be submitted as part of the tender package.
Company Profile must demonstrate a minimum of three (3) similar structural strengthening and concrete repair projects.
Relevant Project Experience will be evaluated (15% of technical evaluation) and must be documented in the tender.
Technical Proposal must detail the methodology, programme, and quality control plan for the works.
Compliance with the Scope of Works (20% of technical evaluation) is required, covering civil, structural, architectural, M&E, and site works.
Methodology and Programme (15% of technical evaluation) must be presented, showing sequencing of inspection, design, reinforcement, concrete repair, and post‑tensioning.
Quality Assurance & Safety Plan (10% of technical evaluation) must be provided, meeting BCA Code of Practice, SS 550, LTA Guidelines, and WSHA requirements.
Contractor must possess equipment and manpower for concrete repair, steel reinforcement installation, post‑tensioning, and temporary works (shoring, propping).
Capability to manage traffic and pedestrian flow in accordance with LTA guidelines is required.
Tenderer must be registered with the Building and Construction Authority (BCA) and comply with BCA Technical Guidelines and any applicable LTA requirements.
Provide a tender security equal to 2 % of the contract value (SGD 9,000) in the form of a bank guarantee, demand draft or certified cheque, valid for 180 days from the Closing Date.
Provide a performance bond equal to 10 % of the contract value as stipulated in Clause 4.1 of the contract.

Maintain public liability insurance with a minimum coverage of SGD 5,000,000 and workers’ compensation insurance in accordance with the Workplace Safety and Health Act, and submit the insurance certificates with the tender.
Demonstrate past experience on similar repair and strengthening works for BCA projects (evaluation weight 10 %).
Submit a company profile and relevant project experience (Annex B) as part of the tender documents.
Comply with all Technical Specifications, i.e., Singapore Standard (SS) specifications applicable to repair and strengthening works, and BCA Technical Guidelines (evaluation weight 40 %).
Submit a detailed Project Programme (Gantt chart) and Resource Plan (evaluation weight 15 %).
Provide a Health & Safety Plan (Annex C) and adhere to the BCA Safety Management System and SS 638 (Construction – Safety).
All personnel attending the mandatory site visit must wear required safety gear (hard hat, high‑visibility vest, safety shoes).
Provide a BCA‑approved Safety Management Plan.
Submit compliance certificates for all referenced Singapore Standards.
Hold ISO 9001:2015 certification for quality management.
Maintain valid Public Liability Insurance of at least SGD 2,000,000.
Obtain a Bank Guarantee equal to 5 % of the Contract Value from a first‑class international bank or a leading Singapore bank approved by the Employer.
Provide a Performance Bond equal to 10 % of the Contract Value.
Include a Bank Guarantee of 5 % of the Contract Value with the tender submission.
Provide a Performance Bond of 10 % of the Contract Value as performance security.
Supply evidence of Public Liability Insurance covering at least SGD 2,000,000.
Complete the Tender Price Schedule (Appendix B) with a detailed breakdown of costs.
Submit a Company Profile demonstrating relevant experience on similar repair and strengthening projects.
Provide CVs of key personnel showing appropriate expertise and experience.
Demonstrate prior experience on structural repair and strengthening works as part of the technical evaluation.
Submit a detailed Method Statement and Work Programme (Appendix C).
Provide compliance certificates for all referenced Singapore Standards.
Include ISO 9001:2015 certification as proof of quality management.
Provide a BCA‑approved Safety Management Plan.
If applicable, submit an Environmental Impact Assessment Report.
Contractor must be registered with the Singapore Building and Construction Authority (BCA) and comply with all relevant BCA Codes of Practice and safety guidelines.
Contractor shall furnish a Performance Bond equal to 10% of the Contract Price.
All works shall be covered by Contractor’s All Risks (CAR) insurance for the duration of the contract.
A retention amount of 5% of each payment shall be held until the issuance of the Defects Certificate.
All civil works must conform to the BCA Code of Practice for Structural Design (SS 554) and applicable LTA guidelines.
Architectural finishes must meet the HDB Design Guidelines for Residential Developments, including Accessibility Code 117.
Mechanical services must comply with Singapore Standard SS 638 for HVAC systems.
Electrical installations must be in accordance with the BCA Electrical Installation Code (SS 638) and the Energy Conservation Act.
Fire detection and alarm systems must meet the SCDF Fire Code and Singapore Standard SS 587.
Project must adhere to the BCA Green Mark Scheme (2023 Edition) for sustainability.
Contractor must comply with all applicable Singapore standards, including Building and Construction Authority (BCA), Land Transport Authority (LTA) and Singapore Standards (SS) codes.
Contractor represents and warrants that it has the expertise, experience and ability to carry out and complete the works fully in accordance with the contract.
Contractor must possess the highest level of competence, knowledge and skill expected of an experienced local contractor.
Contractor must be a professionally qualified and competent designer experienced in work of a similar nature and scope.
Contractor shall provide all superintendence, labour, materials, plant, equipment and other things required for design, execution, completion and remedying of any defects.
Works shall be designed using proven up‑to‑date good practice and to standards consistent with the contract and applicable Singapore standards (BCA, LTA, SS).
Completed works must comply with all applicable rules, regulations and codes having the force of law in Singapore.
Contractor must be a registered contractor with the Building and Construction Authority (BCA) of Singapore and comply with BCA Singapore Building Regulations and Code of Practice.
Contractor must hold the appropriate BCA grading (e.g., Class 1 or Class 2) required for residential development projects.
Contractor must demonstrate sufficient financial strength to support a contract value of SGD 150 million, assessed under the “Financial Strength – 20%” evaluation criterion.
Contractor must provide a bank guarantee covering the mobilisation payment (10% of contract value) as part of the tender submission.
Contractor must submit audited financial statements for the last three financial years.
Contractor must have completed similar residential or mixed‑use development projects of comparable scale (approximately 1,200 units) within the last 5 years.
Contractor must have demonstrated experience in civil, structural, mechanical, electrical, and plumbing works in accordance with Singapore BCA and LTA standards.
Contractor must have successfully delivered projects with a contract value of at least SGD 50 million.

Contractor must possess the technical capability to execute the full scope of works (civil, structural, architectural, mechanical, electrical, and external works), evaluated at 40% of the overall score.
Contractor must have in‑house qualified engineers and specialists for structural design, HVAC, fire‑fighting systems, and renewable energy integration (solar PV).
Contractor must own or have access to plant and equipment required for earthworks, piling, concrete works, and M&E installation.
Contractor must provide a qualified workforce of skilled tradesmen and supervisors, with documented competency and training records.
Contractor must submit a Quality Assurance Plan, Safety Management Plan, and Environmental Management Plan as part of the tender.
All works must comply with relevant Singapore Standards (SS 550, SS 636, SS 638) and Land Transport Authority (LTA) requirements for road and utility interfaces.
Contractor must comply with all applicable statutes and regulations, including any required Building and Construction Authority (BCA) registrations or grades.
Provision of a Performance Security in the amount and form specified, valid for the period required by the contract.
Submission of detailed cash‑flow estimates as part of the tender documentation.
Monthly statements and payments, including retention money, must be submitted in accordance with the contract schedule.
Adequate insurance coverage for works, contractor’s equipment, third‑party liability and accidents must be maintained throughout the contract period.
Contractor must demonstrate prior experience in residential redevelopment projects of comparable scale (e.g., projects valued at or above SGD 100 million).
Evidence of successful completion of similar projects within a 36‑month contract period is required.
Appointment of a qualified Safety Officer responsible for safety, security and environmental protection on site.
Contractor’s representative must possess sufficient language ability to communicate effectively with the Employer Representative.
Contractor must provide sufficient manpower (employees) and skilled labour to meet the programme requirements.
All plant, equipment and temporary works used on the site must be owned or hired by the contractor and approved by the Employer Representative.
Materials, plant and workmanship must meet the quality standards set out in the contract specifications, with required inspections and testing.
Contractor must submit a detailed construction programme and any revised programmes as required.
Compliance with transport and handling requirements for equipment, materials and plant, including road and waterborne traffic regulations.
Submission of a valid Singapore Business Registration Certificate.
Submission of a valid Municipality Trade Licence.

Provide details of the management team (Management information) as part of the Company Organization & Capabilities documentation.
